bibl.title: J.M. Burks and William Moore v. W.J. Tompkins. Writ.
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

msIdentifier.repository: Washington State Archives, Eastern Regional Branch
msIdentifier.collection: Walla Walla County Government; Clerk, Territorial Court Civil/Criminal Case Files, 1860-1891

div1.p: Territory of Washington Walla County } ss. First Judicial District.

To W. Tompkins. Whereas an application has been made pursuant to the statute to Hon. E. P. Oliphant Judge of the United States Court for the 1st Judicial District in and for said Territory and an order granted for a writ of Habeas Corpus for the bodies of J.M. Burks and Wm Moore, who are as is alledged restrained of their liberty.

Therefore in the name of the United States, you are commanded to have the bodies of the said J.M. Burks & Wm Moore before the Hon. E.P. Oliphant at the Court House in the city of Walla Walla WT forth with to do and recieve what shall be ordered concerning them, and have you there this writ the cause of their detention.
Witness my honor & the seal of said Court this 3d day of Oct. A.D. 1884
